channel.title: How do i add items and skills?
channel.description:
Hello,
I was trying to change some stuff in my server. But after some HOURS OF TRYING, i don't know yet how i do this. Please help me!
--
N00bb0y

item.title: How do i add items and skills?
item.dc:creator: @n00bb0y n00bb0y
item.description:
@n00bb0y wrote:

[quote=“Dastan_, post:2, topic:362725”]how to add items is easy , you download a model and you put in in models folder.

then you get that item’s INT’s and put 'em in class8.java

then you go in game and type add models XXXX

XXXX - items ID.[/quote]

where do you need to make the folder???

Read full topic
item.source: How do i add items and skills?

item.title: How do i add items and skills?
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

IDK about adding skills, but if you wanna add items (eg. ags, bgs, etc) I can tell you how?

Just download a model of an item you wanna add.
It should have minimum 2 and maximum 3 model files.
If its a weapon it usually dont have three files, becoz male equip and female equip is same in weapons.
Follow the following steps:

Just search of your desired model from the this link: Click here to get Models stuff

Now get make ints for it, if you dont know how find a model that gives you ints too.

For your basic knowledge: int174 is for model for inventory, int165 is for Male equip model and int200 is for female equip.

Once you have added the model files to ‘Models’ in cache of client-side, now the add ints now. You have to add ints in class8.java.

Here is an example of adding d claws

if(i == 8002){
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield";
class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws";
class8.aByteArray178 = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes();
class8.anInt174 = 13699;
class8.anInt181 = 630;
class8.anInt190 = 268;
class8.anInt198 = 1340;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = -7;
class8.anInt194 = -13;
class8.anInt165 = 13698;
class8.anInt200 = 13698;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
}

Read full topic
